content.p: JFreeCiv is a Java clone of FreeCiv, an open source version of the immensely popular strategy game Civilization.
The freeciv-java mailing list is used to discuss the freeciv java client. To subscribe to this list, see the FreeCiv Mailing Lists Page, or visit the freeciv-java archive on http://arch.freeciv.org.

The freeciv java port was originally developed by Artur Biesiadowski, I spent a furious couple of weeks hacking the source to attempt to upgrade it to support Freeciv 1.10.0 about a year ago, which resulted in rewriting various parts of the client and networking code. Now it talks to a 1.12.0 server, but is far from finished.
If you want to get involved, send mail to the freeciv-java mailing list.

You can use the Bug Database to report problems with JFreeciv, or submit patches for existing bugs. Please use this to report problems with implemented functionality, rather than to track functionality that just hasn't been implemented yet.

If you want to see what we've been working on recently, as well as an overview of the current status, have a look at the
Changelog.
You can download binary and source distributions here.
